issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
On the instance detail view page, the instance type field is displayed as a dropdown menu, which confuses users.

See the attachment.
fields.summary: instance type field shouldn't be in a dropdown menu form

comments.body: This is not a bug. What branch are you in? This was fixed a long time ago, and is not present in develop as of 2/27/2014. Screenshot attached.
This is most definitely not a bug, it's not happening. I don't know what branch you are working in, but this was fixed ages ago and does not appear in develop.

I'm in the latest branch 'develop' on Chrome on Max OS. The log shows that the latest commit is date at:

Date:   Fri Feb 28 16:17:02 2014 -0800

, looking at the exact same dropdown menu on the first attachment. See the latest attachment,
[~kgill] can you please verify that the fix you made for this is in develop? I am not seeing this issue but [~kyolee] is.
[~jloza] [~kgill] My main testing environment is on AWS. So, try it on AWS to see if this issue appears.
[~kyolee]: We *should* display the instance type drop-down for stopped instance only, on Euca and AWS, right [~jloza]?  And the drop-down should be disabled for instances that are not stopped IIRC.
Yep, this should display as a drop down only for stopped instances. :)
[~jloza] Yep, could've sworn we fixed this, but here's another pull request to *really* fix it this time -- https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/271
[~kyolee] you know what to look for here, so I am assigning this to you for review on AWS. Please move to QA when done, thanks!

[~kgill] Not sure if this issue is related to the fix, but when trying to access a stopped instance on AWS, the instance view page errors out with the message below:

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'root_device_type'

 - Expression: "image.root_device_type == 'ebs'"
 - Filename:   /root/koala/koala/templates/instances/instance_view.pt
 - Location:   (line 37: col 43)
 - Source:     ... tal:condition="image.root_device_type == 'ebs'" ng-show="ins ...
                                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

[~kyolee]: Hmm, that's an unusual error.  Maybe try fixing with the following?

tal:condition="image and image.root_device_type == 'ebs'"

[~kgill] we might have a new bug. The issue is that the image was used to launch this instance is not accessible in the current set of images, thus, the entire template errors out since there is no "image" object, thus trying to access any attribute under that object errors out. Will file a new ticket, and passing this ticket to QA.
Verified that no dropdown menu shows up for the instance type field on the instance view page on AWS.

The new ticket related to the issue discovered in the comments above:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-477

verified instance type is text unless the instance is BFEBS in Stopped state.

verified on mac osx 10.9.2, chrome version 33.0.1750.152
